info.name: Game of Fate-Feats
info.description: Feats for the Game of Fate
info.author: Chisato Bailey

description.p: "The truly wise warrior sees the path to victory before battle is even joined."
You gain remarkable insight during battle (bordering on precognition) making you attacks more likely to hit and gaining you the ability to avoid some blows before they even happen.

ul.li: Increase either your Intelligence score or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have Advantage on all attack rolls.

Once per day, you may choose to "see" a successful attack against you and avoid it before the blow lands. This works for all attacks including Magic Missle. This power may NOT be used to warn allies even through magical/telepathic means.

sheet.description: You have Advantage on all attack rolls; and once per day, you may choose to "see" a successful attack against you and avoid it before the blow lands. This works for all attacks including Magic Missle. This power may NOT be used to warn allies even through magical/telepathic means.

description.p: "The canny mind sees many paths when the average mind sees only one, but the truly wise can percieve a strait line where others see only chaos."
You have the proven ability to intuit the most efficient and effective means of persuing any line of inquiry and can even learn answers through divine means.

ul.li: Increase either your Intelligence score or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have Advantage on Insight checks, and on all Intelligence skill checks.
Once per day, you may learn any single piece of information you want to know. (The DM has final discretion regarding this power's effects.)

sheet.description: You have Advantage on Insight checks, and on all Intelligence skill checks. Once per day, you may learn any single piece of information you want to know. (The DM has final discretion regarding this power's effects.)

description.p: "Often, the most direct path is the most effective solution to any problem."

You have spent a great deal of time aiding others, as such you have grown sensitive to the patterns of injustice and oppression and have learned how to interrupt these cycles before they have the chance to take hold.

ul.li: Increase either your Intelligence score or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have Advantage on all Charisma-based skill checks.
You learn (by multiple means) of acts of injustice near you in time to stop or even prevent them.
Once per day, you may either grant your party a full surprise round at the beginning of combat -OR- you may grant only yourself an extra attack action every round during one combat.
